question.body: Which of the following statements is correct?

multiple_choice.choice: chronic pain typically involves signals carried on A-delta type
nociceptors of the skin transmit mainly fast pain on C fibers
C fibers would adapt after a period of time
A-delta fibers are involved in pain-reflexes, such as withdrawing your burned hand

response.feedback: Incorrect. Chronic pain is associated with both slow somatic and slow visceral receptors with C fibers.
Incorrect. Skin nociceptors can generate either fast pain or the more slowly conducted burning or aching pain, depending upon their fiber type.
Incorrect. Nociceptors do not usually adapt, as it is important that we continue to perceive pain in order to help prevent further injury.
Correct. The quick response will initiate a protective withdrawal reflex. Some of the pain sensation may be slightly delayed if nociceptors with C fibers are also activated.

part.hint: Think about the speed of transmission being described and the type of fiber that would be needed to accomplish this.
